DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective clinical trial determine whether new extensively hydrolyze infant formula hypoallergenic .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Born term ( > 36 week gestation ) 2 . Two ( 2 ) month ≤ 12 year age enrollment 3 . Documented Cow 's Milk Allergy ( CMA ) within 6 month prior enrollment : 1 . Reported convincing allergic symptom follow exposure milk milkcontaining food product [ detectable serum milkspecific IgE ( > 0.7 kIU/L ) positive skin prick test ( wheal great 5 mm ] ) , OR 2 . Physiciansupervised oral food challenge elicit immediate allergic symptom , OR 3 . Results laboratory test highly predictive clinical reactivity milk Serum milk IgE ≥15 [ kIU/L ] ≥ 5 [ kIU/L younger 1 year OR , Skin prick test mean wheal > 10 mm 4 . Otherwise healthy 5 . If subject asthma , atopic dermatitis , and/or rhinitis , must well control 6 . Expected daily intake least 8 oz ( 240 ml ) study formula open challenge phase 7 . Having obtain his/her legal representative 's informed consent . 1 . Children consume mother 's milk time inclusion trial 2 . Any chromosomal major congenital anomaly 3 . Any major gastrointestinal disease abnormality CMA 4 . Chronic medical disease ( ie seizure disorder , chronic lung disease , heart problem ( heart murmur acceptable ) 5 . Immunodeficiency 6 . Receiving free amino acid formula 7 . Antihistamine use 7 day prior first food challenge ( eyedrop acceptable ) 8 . Oral steroid use within 14 day prior enrollment ( intranasal topical corticosteroid okay ) 9 . Unstable asthma 10 . Severe uncontrolled eczema 11 . Recent ( within last 3 month ) severe anaphylactic reaction milk 12 . Subject Investigator 's assessment expect adhere study protocol 13 . Currently participate another clinical trial
